briefdescription.para: Percentage along the path at each vertex (0 being start of path, and 1 being the end)
Total distance between the vertices of the polyline.
Total distance from the first vertex up to each vertex in the polyline.
Bounding box of the path.
Equal to (0,0,-1) for 2D paths, and (0,1,0) for XZ paths.

memberdef.argsstring: (BezierPath bezierPath, Transform transform, float maxAngleError=0.3f, float minVertexDst=0)
memberdef.name: VertexPath

briefdescription.para: Splits bezier path into array of vertices along the path.

detaileddescription.para: param name="maxAngleError">How much can the angle of the path change before a vertex is added. This allows fewer vertices to be generated in straighter sections.
param name="minVertexDst">Vertices won't be added closer together than this distance, regardless of angle error.

briefdescription.para: Splits bezier path into array of vertices along the path.

detaileddescription.para: param name="maxAngleError">How much can the angle of the path change before a vertex is added. This allows fewer vertices to be generated in straighter sections.
param name="minVertexDst">Vertices won't be added closer together than this distance, regardless of angle error.
param name="accuracy">Higher value means the change in angle is checked more frequently.

briefdescription.para: Gets point on path based on distance travelled.
Gets forward direction on path based on distance travelled.
Gets normal vector on path based on distance travelled.
Gets a rotation that will orient an object in the direction of the path at this point, with local up point along the path's normal.
Gets point on path based on 'time' (where 0 is start, and 1 is end of path).
Gets forward direction on path based on 'time' (where 0 is start, and 1 is end of path).
Gets normal vector on path based on 'time' (where 0 is start, and 1 is end of path).
Gets a rotation that will orient an object in the direction of the path at this point, with local up point along the path's normal.
Finds the closest point on the path from any point in the world.
Finds the 'time' (0=start of path, 1=end of path) along the path that is closest to the given point.
Finds the distance along the path that is closest to the given point.
Internal contructor.

detaileddescription.para: For a given value 't' between 0 and 1, calculate the indices of the two vertices before and after t. Also calculate how far t is between those two vertices as a percentage between 0 and 1.

briefdescription.para: Calculate time data for closest point on the path from given world point.

detaileddescription.para: A vertex path is a collection of points (vertices) that lie along a bezier path. This allows one to do things like move at a constant speed along the path, which is not possible with a bezier path directly due to how they're constructed mathematically. This class also provides methods for getting the position along the path at a certain distance or time (where time = 0 is the start of the path, and time = 1 is the end of the path). Other info about the path (tangents, normals, rotation) can also be retrieved in this manner.
